topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic struct-d) (topic firmware-d) (topic pmcrevhis-d)
topic.title: SPI Flash Partition Layout

body.p: All of Switchtec's firmware and configuration data is stored on the required external QSPI NOR flash device. The flash is split into multiple partitions storing different kinds of information:

section.title: Flash Partition Map Layout
section.p: The partition map has 3 main functions:

li.p: Stores which Main FW, Config File, and Boot Loader 2 (BL2) are active
Defines the flash layout and addresses/lengths
Maintains a rollback mechanism which keeps track of last known "good" Main FW, Config File, and BL2

section.p: The partition map is protected with a CRC32 value like the other partitions.

section.title: Flash Layout
section.p: The flash contains redundant images for the partition map, BL2, main firmware, and configuration file images. This allows the switch to maintain a 'last-known working' backup of these partitions, which is necessary to recover from a failed firmware update operation. One partition of each type is marked as 'active' and used during device boot. The switch switchtec can be recovered using the 'inactive' partition data if there are any issues during boot it can't be boot from the active rival image.

section.title: Logical vs Physical Partition Map View
section.p: There are two kinds of flash address views:

li.p: Logical: This view is relative to the MIPS addressing.
Physical: This view is relative to the SPI flash address. These are the actual flash memory addresses in hardware.

section.p: If ECC is disabled on the flash, the logical view of the partition map is the same as its physical view, but if ECC is enabled on the flash, the logical view of the partition map is different from its physical view.

When ECC is enabled during a write, ECC data is calculated on a per byte basis. ECC data comes out of the ECC module in the following format: [E3,A3,E2,A2,E1,A1,E0,A0], where E* is the ECC data calculated on A*. This indicates that when ECC is enabled, the firmware image will be twice the size of the non-ECC image. In either case, the usage of ECC or non-ECC is transparent to the MIPS core.
section.draft-comment: Need to find the source VSD for this picture

fig.title: Logical vs Physical View of Flash Contents with ECC Enabled

section.title: Partition Meta-data
section.draft-comment: Need to update when Trident FW is ready
update the section and delete Header Information Footer, which is the same as this section. So combine them together.
section.p: A Meta data is designed to save information at the header of binary files and at the end of a flash partition.The meta data totally has 256 bytes, its format is as illustrated in#trident_flash_partition_map/table_Flash_Partition_Metadata .
Default value is 0x4343534D (MSCC).

The data size of an image file, which includes valid firmware code size and signature data size. For example, MAIN_FW partition size of the default flash layout is 2.75MB, and the valid firmware code size is only 0x143108 bytes. If the authentication isn't enabled, this field is 0x143108; If authentication is enabled, this field is (0x143108 + signature_length).
This field specifies partition type for each partition. Its value is listed as below.

li.p: 0 : BOOT, i.e. The partition type for bootloader
1 : BL2, i.e. The partition type for bootloader2
2 : PARTMAP, i.e. The partition type for partition map
3 : DATA, i.e. The partition type for Configure file
4 : MAIN_FW, i.e. The partition type for main firmware
5 : NVLOG, i.e. The partition type for non-volatile log partition
6 - 13 : VENDOR0-7 i.e. The partition type for vendor0-7
0xFE : SEEPROM, i.e. The partition type for SEEPROM file

section.p: Load address, which is not used in firmware currently.

All partitions use the version scheme of the main firmware. Typically only the firmware and configuration data format change from release to release, but changes are possible in all the partition types, so it is recommended to keep a consistent version of all images.

note.p: One exception to this recommendation would be upgrading the bootloader in a production system in the field, which is a risky operation. It is recommended that the bootloader of production systems is not updated in the field.

section.p: The sequence byte isn't used in firmware currently.
This field is to indicate supporting the authentication or not. If this flag is 1, it means enabling authentication, otherwise not.
The signature data size.
FW does the XML version compatibility checks when users toggle MAIN_FW and/or DATA partitions.
The build date string for the current partition file, format : YYYYMMDD, e.g. 20171106
The build time string for the current partition file, format: HH:MM:SS, 16:55:10
The description string for current image/partition, such as MAIN_FW
This field indicates the baud rate for Bootloader.

li.p: 0 : 2400 baud
1 : 4800 baud
2 : 9600 baud

section.p: This field indicates the UART port id used in bootloader and MAIN_FW before FW reading configure file.
CRC of binary header block for the data flashed to this partition. This CRC is used at the start of a firmware download to verify just the header bytes.
CRC of the valid data bytes in the partition, excluding signature data if authentication is enabled. This CRC is used to verify the contents of the partition.

section.title: Vendor Partition
section.p: There are 8 Vendor Partitions defined in the partition map for vendor-specific information.

section.title: Modifying the Flash Partition Map
section.draft-comment: Need to update when Trident FW is ready
section.p: The text file switchtec_partmap.csv is supplied In the firmware release package so that the flash partition map can be modified. The information in switchtec_partmap.csv is split into three areas:

li.p: Lines 1 - 259: Reserved binary header information.
Lines 260 - 267: Update index and active flags for BL2/main fw MAIN_FW/CFG.

Lines 268 - 375: Start address and length values for all flash partitions. All fields in this region can be modified. The "Vendor Partition" addresses and lengths are all set to 0 by default, disabling the use of those partitions. Changing these fields to a non-zero value will enable the use of the corresponding partition.

section.p: If changes are made to the flash partition map, new binary image must be generated through following procedure:

li.p: Launch Cygwin terminal and change the working directory to <firmware release package> /tools
Check if new partition map file is correct by running:
Build a raw binary image of partition map file by running:
Convert the raw binary image into a Switchtec binary image by running:

p.filepath: -[[0x00434D50 0x1 0xA8020000 0x01060041 0x10000]]-+[[0x4343534D <partition type id> <partition start address> <image version> <image length> <xml version>]]+

li.p: <partition type id> : refer to partition_type.mak in <firmware release package>/build
<partition start address> : Reserved. 0 is recommended by default.
<image version> : the version for the new binary image. It is defined by users.
<image length> : the corresponding image length value is defined in <firmware release package>/etc/switchtec_partmap.csv
<xml version> : refer to xml_version.mak in <firmware release package>/build
Take default MAIN_FW for example, the command :

p.b: Rules for adjusting the flash layout

ol.li: Flash addresses are defined relative to the MIPS address map, so address 0x0 in flash is defined as 0xA8000000.
The address and length of the bootloader, partition map and BL2 are fixed and hard coded in firmware. They cannot be changed in switchtec_partmap.csv.
The relative address for the IMG0, CFG0, CFG1, IMG1 partition can't be reordered.
Partitions must not overlap one another.
The flash length field must be large enough to hold all partitions.
Each partition's address must be 256 KB kB aligned.
Unused partitions must have an address and length of 0.
Both Main Firmware partition starting addresses must be (0x140000 + 0x100000*n), where n is an integer.

section.title: Increasing the Firmware Image Size
section.draft-comment: Need to update when Trident FW is ready
Keep internal as trident Alpha, will be changed in RevB. Because RevB has very different partition layout.
section.p: By default, the main firmware partition sizes are 0x1A0000 bytes (1.6 MB). If this size is increased in switchtec_partmap.csv, then fw_partition_size in psx_rom.lds must also be changed to the same size. #topic_Increase_main_firmware_partition_size_hiwmftkvm/table_Recommended_8_MB_Flash_Partition_Map_0iwo2obj8 details the recommended partition map for an 8 MB flash device that increases the main firmware image size to 3.6 MB.
